ghostPost.plaintext:
Integrate your LiveChat account with Ghost and install a chat widget on your
site to connect with readers

Publishers, journalists and website creators can use LiveChat
[https://www.livechatinc.com/?utm_source=ghost&utm_campaign=integration]  to
speak with readers in real time, provide answers, gather feedback and grow
subscribers. It takes just a few minutes to plug LiveChat into your site using
using code injection. Follow this guide to find out how! 

Copy the LiveChat installation code
In your LiveChat account, open the Agent App and head to Settings ‚Üí Channels ‚Üí 
Chat widget [https://my.livechatinc.com/settings/code]  and use the copy code
option to grab your installation snippet. 

Install using code injection
Paste your installation code into the Footer  section in the site-wide code
injection feature in Ghost Admin:

Hit save and you're good to go - head to your site to test your new integration
is working. The LiveChat icon will appear in the bottom right hand corner of
your site on every page and clicking it will open up the widget.

Customise your LiveChat widget
The rest is up to you! LiveChat offer plenty of ways to customise your widget
with design, branding and behaviour. Check out their handy tutorial
[https://www.livechatinc.com/kb/customize-your-chat/]  on how to do this.
